title: How do you know if you have a virus? - Cella Wright

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary purpose of PCR testing in diagnosing viral infections?

options.label: A
options.text: To detect the presence of antibodies in the body

options.text: To target the virus's genetic material in the body

options.label: C
options.text: To measure the amount of virus present in the body

options.label: D
options.text: To identify the type of virus present in the body

What is the primary purpose of immunoassays in diagnosing viral infections?

options.label: A
options.text: To detect the presence of the virus's genetic material

options.label: B
options.text: To target the virus-specific antibodies generated by the immune system

options.label: C
options.text: To measure the amount of virus present in the body

options.label: D
options.text: To identify the type of virus present in the body

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between PCR and immunoassays in diagnosing viral infections?

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: PCR is more accurate than immunoassays

options.label: D
options.text: Immunoassays are more efficient than PCR

options.label: A
options.text: To detect the presence of the virus's genetic material

options.label: B
options.text: To measure the amount of virus present in the body

options.label: C
options.text: To identify the type of virus present in the body

options.label: D
options.text: To detect the presence of the virus's genetic material by detecting fluorescence

multiple-choice.question: What type of PCR is used to quantify individual pieces of target DNA?

options.label: A
options.text: They are more accurate than standard PCR devices

options.label: B
options.text: They are more efficient than standard PCR devices

options.label: C
options.text: They can relay results within one hour

options.label: D
options.text: They are more expensive than standard PCR devices

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of using blood plasma from individuals who have developed immunity to a virus?

options.label: A
options.text: To treat individuals who are currently fighting the virus

options.label: B
options.text: To diagnose individuals who have been infected

options.label: C
options.text: To measure the amount of virus present in the body

options.label: D
options.text: To identify the type of virus present in the body

multiple-choice.question: What is the potential benefit of using immunoassays in diagnosing people who were infected but went untested?

options.text: They can provide more accurate results than PCR testing

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: They can be used to diagnose past infections and provide a sense of closure for individuals who were infected but went untested

options.label: D
options.text: They can be used to identify the type of virus present in the body

title: Why do bats carry so many diseases? (like coronavirus)

multiple-choice.question: Which viruses are mentioned in the transcript as being extremely fatal?

options.label: C
options.text: The recent rise of human-bat interactions

options.label: B
options.text: Because bats have a strong immune system

options.text: Because different kinds of bats often roost together in huge numbers and close quarters

options.label: C

options.label: C
options.text: They require a low internal temperature

options.text: They require a strong immune system

options.label: C
options.text: Because they can survive in a cold environment

options.label: D
options.text: Because they can survive in a hot environment

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: We can learn how to produce a lot of reactive waste products

options.text: Because bats are less social than humans

options.label: C
options.text: Because humans are more likely to interact with other humans

options.label: D
options.text: Because bats are more likely to interact with other bats

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: By leaving bats alone and trying to control the spread of diseases carried by a different kind of flying mammal

multiple-choice.question: Why are bats able to survive the deadly viruses they carry?

options.text: Because they have a strong immune system

options.label: B
options.text: Because they are able to produce a lot of reactive waste products

options.label: D

options.label: B
options.text: The nerves send messages to the brain.

multiple-choice.question: What is the process called when the brain decodes the messages from the nerves?
What is the sense of touch dependent on?
Why doesn't it hurt when you cut your hair?

options.label: A
options.text: Because hair has nerves in it.

options.label: B
options.text: Because hair doesn't have nerves in it.

options.label: C
options.text: Because you're not pulling on it.

options.label: D
options.text: Because you're not moving it around.

options.label: B
options.text: They don't have nerves in them.

multiple-choice.question: Why doesn't it hurt when you cut your nails?

options.label: A
options.text: Because nails have nerves in them.

options.label: B
options.text: Because nails don't have nerves in them.

options.label: C
options.text: Because you're not pulling on them.

options.label: D
options.text: Because you're not moving them around.

multiple-choice.question: What is the reason why haircuts don't hurt?

options.label: A
options.text: Because hair has nerves in it.

options.label: B
options.text: Because hair doesn't have nerves in it.

options.label: C
options.text: Because you're not pulling on it.

options.label: D
options.text: Because you're not moving it around.

title: Why is my leg asleep?

multiple-choice.question: What happens to the nerves in your arm or leg when you sit in one position for a while?

options.label: C
options.text: They don't get enough blood supply.

multiple-choice.question: What is the sensation called when your arm or leg starts to feel prickly after you move it?
Why do people say that an arm or leg "fell asleep" when it goes numb?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it was asleep like you are when you fall asleep at night.

options.label: B
options.text: Because it's called that because you can't feel much with it while it's numb.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why your arm or leg can start to go numb when you sit in one position for a while?

options.label: B
options.text: Because of lack of blood supply.

multiple-choice.question: What are the little things called that are all over your body and help you feel sensations like touch, hot, or cold?
Why do nerves get a little confused when they wake up after being numb?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they're not getting enough blood supply.

options.label: B
options.text: Because they're getting too much blood supply.

options.label: C
options.text: Because they're telling your brain that you're feeling tiny little pokes.

multiple-choice.question: What happens to the prickling sensation in your arm or leg after a minute or two?
What can you do to help the blood get flowing again if you get pins and needles?

options.label: A
options.text: Shake around the arm or leg.

options.label: B
options.text: Sit in one position for a while.

options.label: C
options.text: Wait for a minute or two.

multiple-choice.question: Why is it important for blood to move through all the parts of your body?

options.label: A
options.text: So they can get energy to work properly.

options.label: B
options.text: So they can get oxygen to work properly.

options.label: C
options.text: So they can get water to work properly.

options.label: D
options.text: So they can get food to work properly.

multiple-choice.question: What can you do to keep yourself from getting pins and needles?

options.label: A
options.text: Sit or lean in one position for too long.

options.label: B
options.text: Make sure you don't sit or lean in one position for too long.

options.label: C
options.text: Shake around your arm or leg all the time.

can you identify the type of syllable in the word "me"? Is it an open or closed syllable?

title: Human, capital & natural resources for kids | Types of resources

multiple-choice.question: What is a resource?

options.label: A
options.text: A thing that people use to meet their needs.

options.label: B
options.text: A type of service that someone provides.

options.label: C
options.text: A type of good that people use.

multiple-choice.question: What are human resources?

options.label: A
options.text: Goods that are made and used to provide a service.

options.label: B
options.text: Things that are found on earth and can be used by people.

options.label: D
options.text: Tools and equipment used to make goods.

multiple-choice.question: What is a service?

options.label: A
options.text: Something that someone does for you.

options.label: B
options.text: A type of good that people use.

multiple-choice.question: What are capital resources?

options.label: A
options.text: Goods that are made and used to provide a service.

options.label: C
options.text: Things that are found on earth and can be used by people.

options.label: D
options.text: Tools and equipment used to make goods.

multiple-choice.question: What are natural resources?

options.label: A
options.text: Things that are made by people.

options.label: B
options.text: Goods that are used to provide a service.

options.label: C
options.text: Things that are found on earth and can be used by people.

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following is an example of a human resource?
Which of the following is an example of a capital resource?
Which of the following is an example of a natural resource?
What is the main difference between human resources and capital resources?

options.label: A
options.text: Human resources are people who provide a service, while capital resources are goods that are made and used to provide a service.

options.label: B
options.text: Human resources are goods that are made and used to provide a service, while capital resources are people who provide a service.

options.label: C
options.text: Human resources are things that are found on earth and can be used by people, while capital resources are goods that are made and used to provide a service.

options.label: D
options.text: Human resources are people who provide a service, while capital resources are things that are found on earth and can be used by people.

multiple-choice.question: Why are natural resources important?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they are made by people.

options.label: B
options.text: Because they are used to provide a service.

options.label: C
options.text: Because they are found on earth and can be used by people.

options.label: D
options.text: Because they are not needed by people.
